summary: This document is an email chain between FBI agents discussing the scheduling of an interview with a witness (referred to as 'U') regarding Leon Black. It includes planning for an interpreter and coordination with the witness's attorney. The emails reference attached FBI 302 reports concerning Black.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of FBI 302 reports that are being discussed and attached in the email chain. The interview being scheduled is related to him.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Primary correspondent in the email chain, working from the FBI New York Field Office on the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk. They are coordinating the interview logistics, including room booking and interpreter arrangements.

persons.name: C-20
persons.context: Mentioned as wanting to sit in on the interview but being very busy, which may delay scheduling.

connections.description: FBI colleagues coordinating an investigation and interview related to Leon Black, as shown in their email exchanges about scheduling and sharing documents.
The Special Agent is involved in an investigation concerning Leon Black, as indicated by the discussion of 302s and interview planning related to him.

events.title: Scheduled interview with witness
events.description: An interview with a witness (referred to as 'U') was scheduled for May 18, 2021, at 10:30 AM, involving FBI agents and potentially an interpreter.

events.title: Follow-up on Leon Black 302s
events.description: An email follow-up regarding obtaining copies of FBI 302 reports referencing Leon Black, in preparation for a meeting with PC chiefs.

locations: 290 Broadway (conference room location mentioned for the interview)
keyFacts: FBI agents were actively investigating Leon Black in May 2021, as indicated by the discussion of 302 reports and an interview with a witness.
The interview planning involved considerations for a Russian interpreter, suggesting the witness may be a Russian speaker.
The email chain reveals coordination between FBI agents and the witness's attorney to schedule the interview.
The investigation falls under the FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk in the New York Field Office.
